statsBulletinHeadline.headline1: Change in gross domestic product (GDP) is the main indicator of economic growth. GDP increased by 0.8% in Q2 2014, the second consecutive quarter on quarter increase of 0.8%.
statsBulletinHeadline.headline2: GDP was 3.1% higher in Q2 2014 compared with the same quarter a year ago.
statsBulletinHeadline.headline3: In Q2 2014 GDP was estimated to be 0.2% above the peak in Q1 2008. From peak to trough in 2009, the economy shrank by 7.2%.
statsBulletinHeadline.title: GDP Preliminary Estimate Q3 2014
statsBulletinHeadline.summary: Preliminary estimate for Gross Domestic Product (GDP) containing constant price Gross Value Added (GVA) data for the UK. Data is available split by industrial sector.

datasets.summary: High level overview of the economy

statsBulletins.title: GDP Preliminary Estimate Q3 2014
statsBulletins.summary: Preliminary estimate for Gross Domestic Product (GDP) containing constant price Gross Value Added (GVA) data for the UK. Data is available split by industrial sector.

title: Gross Domestic Product (GDP)
summary: Gross domestic product (GDP) is a measure of economic activity which captures the value of goods and services that a country produces during a given period.

breadcrumb.title: Home
breadcrumb.summary: The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.

breadcrumb.title: Economy
breadcrumb.summary: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.
